Package com.example.inventorymanager.ui.addItem

Class addItemFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.inventorymanager.ui.addItem.addItemFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class addItemFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
The addItemFragment class is a fragment that displays a series of editable fields. There are eight total fields that a user can edit: the item name, the purchase date of the item, the description of the item, the make of the item, the model of the item, the serial number of the item, the estimated price of the value, and a comment. Once all required fields are filled the user may add the item to the item view which is displayed in the home view.
Author:
Kareem Assaf, Tyler Hoekstra, Isaac Joffe, David Onchuru, Tomasz Ayobahan

    • handleCameraResult

      private void handleCameraResult(android.content.Intent data)
      Handles the result from the camera activity. Takes the selected photo and converts it to Bitmap in order for it to be processed an inserted to a imageView.
      Parameters:
      data - The Intent containing the result data from the camera activity.

    • processImageResult

      private void processImageResult(android.graphics.Bitmap photo)
      Processes the result of selecting or capturing an image. Handles the flow of which imageView to insert the photo and handles the saving locally of the images.
      Parameters:
      photo - The Bitmap representing the selected or captured image.
